sen.j: 好事福櫨（こうずぶくろ） は、明治に京都の和菓子職人が考案したと云われる珍菓。
sen.e: Kozubukuro is nice Japanese sweets created by a Japanese pastry chef in Kyoto in the Meiji period.
Kozubukuro is nice Japanese sweet created by a Japanese pastry chef in Kyoto during the Meiji period.
Kozubukuro is nice Japanese sweet created by a Japanese pastry chef in Kyoto during the Meiji period.

sen.j: 春から晩秋までの期間限定品である。
sen.e: Kozubukuro is sold for a limited time from spring to late fall.
Kozubukuro is sold for a limited time from spring to late fall.
Kozubukuro is sold for a limited time from spring to late fall.

sen.j: 大振の紀州みかんの果肉を刳り貫き、ジュース状にして砂糖・リキュール等で調整して寒天で固めたもの。
sen.e: The flesh of a large Kishu orange is hollowed out, liquidized, and adjusted with sugar and liquor to jellify with kanten (agar).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The flesh of a large Kishu orange is hollowed out, liquidized, and adjusted with sugar and liquor to jellify with kanten (agar).
The flesh of a large Kishu orange is hollowed out, liquidized, and adjusted with sugar and liquor to jellify with kanten (agar).

sen.j: 和風の涼菓であるが今日のフルーツゼリーの原型と考えてよいだろう。
sen.e: Kozubukuro is Japanese cool sweets and can be regarded as the original form of the present-day fruit jelly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kozubukuro is Japanese cool sweet and can be regarded as the original form of the present-day fruit jelly.
Kozubukuro is Japanese cool sweet and can be regarded as the original form of the present-day fruit jelly.

sen.j: 京都市内の鉄道駅や百貨店等でもあまり見かけない希少品で多くの食通や風流人からも愛されている。
sen.e: It is rare to get kozubukuro at stations or department stores in Kyoto City and kozubukuro is loved by many gourmets and people of taste.
It is rare to get kozubukuro at stations or department stores in Kyoto City and kozubukuro is loved by many gourmets and people of taste.
